alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Johnson; Magoffin; Morgan; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 3:32PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Morgan, southwestern Johnson, north central Breathitt, northern Magoffin and east central Wolfe Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 332 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Burg, or 11 miles west of Salyersville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Netty, Cannel City, Seiltz, Puncheon, Eugene, Cornelia and Panama around 335 PM EDT. Lewis, Lykins, Bethanna, Hager, Epson, Holliday, Caney, Stella, Ova and Stacy Fork around 340 PM EDT. Wonnie, Patton, Harper, Elsie, Kernie, Williams, Gifford, Gullett, White Oak and Gordon Ford around 345 PM EDT. Salyersville, Mason, Bloomington, Cisco, Licksburg, Matthew, Florress, Cottle and Lakesville around 350 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Plutarch, Coon, Tella, Orient, Haleburg, Logville, Perlie, Cyrus, Stringtown, Mashfork, Lacey, Quod, Grayfox, Ever, Minefork, Flat Fork, Win, Wheelersburg, Leatha and Hargis. THIS INCLUDES Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 52 and 76. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
